net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Class DynamicResourceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.DynamicResourceFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceFactory

    public class DynamicResourceFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceFactory
    Factory for dynamic resources.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • createResource

        public FactoryResource createResource(java.lang.String persistentResourceId)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceFactory
        Creates a resource object from a persistent resource ID. The meaning of the ID depends on the factory implementation. The intent is that the ID depends on the source of the resource, such as a database. In that case the ID would be the unique identifier in the database.
        Specified by:
        createResource in interface ResourceFactory
        Parameters:
        persistentResourceId - the peristent resource ID.
        Returns:
        Resource or null if the resource cannot be created, for example if it does not exist.

      • getFactoryId

        public java.lang.String getFactoryId()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceFactory
        Get the ID of the factory. This ID is used to identify the factory and must be consistent across instances of the factory.
        Specified by:
        getFactoryId in interface ResourceFactory
        Returns:
        String.

      • purgeExpired

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> purgeExpired()
        Purges expired resources from the resource manager. Resources that are still registered will not be purged. This method must be called from a synchronized block that is using the ResourceManager instance as the monitor.
        Returns:
        Collection of resource IDs that were purged.

      • register

        public java.lang.String register(net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource resource)
        Register a resource with no expire time.
        Parameters:
        resource - The Resource to provide.
        Returns:
        The ID for the resource.
        See Also:
        register(Resource, long)

      • register

        public java.lang.String register(net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource resource,
                                 long expire)
        Register a resource.
        Parameters:
        resource - The Resource to provide.
        expire - The expire time, -1 to disable expiration.
        Returns:
        The ID for the resource.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if resource is null.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(java.lang.String id)
        Unregister a resource. This is not valid for FactoryBasedResources.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the resource.
